thread.title: Ingenico said to have secured financing for Worldpay bid
thread.title_full: Ingenico said to have secured financing for Worldpay bid

title: Ingenico said to have secured financing for Worldpay bid
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Sep 4, 2015, 17:55 BST - UK Markets closed Ingenico said to have secured financing for Worldpay bid By Michele Maatouk | Sharecast – 2 hours 54 minutes ago 519928.SW 0.00 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - French payments processing group Ingenico (Paris: FR0000125346 - news ) has reportedly lined up financing from HSBC, Natixis (Paris: FR0000120685 - news ) and Societe Generale (Swiss: 519928.SW - news ) for a £6bn-plus all-cash takeover bid for Worldpay. The financing plan, which was reported by Sky News , comes days after it emerged that Ingenico had tabled an offer to buy its UK rival and persuade it to abandon a planned stock market flotation. 
According to Sky (LSE: BSY.L - news ) , Ingenico, which has a market value of €6.5bn, is up against bids from Germany's Wirecard (Xetra: 747206 - news ) and a private equity consortium comprising Blackstone (NYSE: BX - news ) , Hellman & Friedman and Singapore's Government Investment Corporation. 
Worldpay's owners, Advent International and Bain Capital are expected to decide this autumn whether to go ahead with plans for a London listing or opt for a sale.
